newsitem.title: USA: Hollywood Casino Q3 hurt by competition.
newsitem.headline: Hollywood Casino Q3 hurt by competition.

text.p: Hollywood Casino Corp on Thursday said increased competition, particularly in Atlantic City, hurt third quarter earnings.
The company reported a net loss of $8.4 million, or $0.34 per share, for its third quarter compared with net income of $7.1 million, or $0.29 per share, for the same period of the prior year.
"An unprecedented market share war continues to rage in Atlantic City," Edward T. Pratt III, Hollywood's president and chief operating officer, said in a statement.
He continued, "the industry's rate of spending on marketing programs far exceeds the rate of real casino growth. As a result, pressure on revenues and operating margins continues to be intense."
"Additionally, increases in casino capacity in both the Chicago and Tunica markets put pressure on margins at our two Hollywood Casino properties during the quarter," he said.
